title: Who is the best Vice President who never became President? - Quora
tags: Political History of the United States of America
Presidents of the United States of America
History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Depends on what you mean by “best.” Until recently, VPs didn’t have to do very much, so there is much of a muchness to choose from. Later on, Mondale, Gore, Cheney, and Biden took on a lot more work. As for potentially great presidents who never made it past the #2 spot, Hubert Humphrey is a reasonable bet. He ended up tarnishing his legacy by being too close to LBJ but he was a great senator. Rockefeller was perhaps the wrong personality type to survive under the world spotlight, but is another interesting option.

Hands-down, without a doubt, Thomas Jefferson. Vice President to John Adams, succeeded him and became the third president of United States. John F. Kennedy while hosting a dinner for several Nobel prize winners famously quipped that “This is the most brain power ever assembled in the White House dining room… with the exception of when Thomas Jefferson dined alone.” I’m pretty sure he was right.
